title: SB 1.17.33 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 13-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namao Vishnu Padaya Krishna Prishtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Srivasadi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Jai Vanarottamam Devi Msanaswati
Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 33rd verse of the 17th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Navarthi Tavyam Tad Adharma Bandho
Dharmena Satyencha Varthi Tavye
Brahma Varte Yatra Yajanti Yajner
Yajneshwaram Yajna Vitaam
Vigna Vitana Vignaha
The meaning of this verse is

Therefore, O friend of irreligion, you do not deserve to remain in a place where experts perform sacrifices according to truth and religious principles for the satisfaction of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
These are words spoken by the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
These are words spoken by the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
Shri Gautama Shetty
Parijkshit Maharaj
For your refresh memory, while Parikshit was touring the kingdom, he came across this Kali Purusha trying to beat a bull and a cow.
The bull was standing just on one leg, somehow hobbling along,
the cow had tears in her eyes and she seemed to be unprotected and this Kali
Purusha was actually a low-class person dressed as a king but his activity his
action was harming the cow and the bull so immediately Parikshit took out a sword to
kill this Kali Purusha but Kali Purusha actually he completely surrendered to the
king when he saw Kali Purusha.
there was no way he could escape. So since Kalipurusha surrendered, Pariksit did not want
to kill him but he said you cannot remain in my kingdom because you are the friend of irreligion,
atharma bandhu. So, he is addressing in this verse why is a personality like Kalipurusha
not allowed to live in the kingdom of Pariksit Maharaj. So, the Kingdom of Pariksit Maharaj
is a place where experts perform sacrifices according to truth and
religion and morality, filial routine and morality, affinity and morality. So, all these
principles for the satisfaction of the Supreme Personality, if you got it. Such a place is called
Brahmavarta. It is not only one place, but it is wherever, any place on the surface of this globe,
where the Supreme Lord is worshipped according to the principles of the authorized scriptures.
And that is explained in the purport by Srila Prabhupada.
Agneshwara, or the Supreme Personality, if you got it, is the beneficiary of all kinds of
sacrificial ceremonies.
This is a statement of the Bhagavad Gita. The Supreme Lord is called Yajneshwara. Yajneshwara. He is the enjoyer, the beneficiary, the object of all sacrifices,
which are performed according to the scriptural directions, which are authorized by the standard scriptures, which are not manufactured by some person of this world, no.
So, Srila Prabhupada says,
such sacrificial ceremonies are performed according to the scriptural directions,
are prescribed differently in the scriptures for different ages.
Now the shastras are recommending different types of sacrifice for different yugas in
this earth planet.
Different yugas, the conditions are different, the living conditions are different.
In Satya yuga, most people are situated in the mode of goodness.
They are all spiritually inclined, they are very much religious minded, they follow the
scriptural directions.
So for that age the method of sacrifice was?
God.
Absolutely correct.
the performance of meditation on the Supreme Lord within the heart. Vishnu seated in the
heart is Paramatma, meditation on Paramatma. And that was feasible in that age in Satyayuga.
There was a long duration of life for people and people were very, very sober, peaceful.
They were satisfied with all the necessities being met with by the arrangement of the Supreme
Lord through the material nature. So even now if you go to the Himalayas, of course
it is rare.
But there are people who are living in certain secluded places, remote places in the Himalayas
where there is plenty of fruits available, nice water for bathing, drinking, everything,
pure water.
And there are caves for living under the, under the, under the, under the, under the
water.
And they are there as a place of shelter.
And then their mind is completely controlled, so they are able to direct their mind, focus
their mind on meditation on this Supreme Lord in the heart as directed by the shastras.
So the Bhagavatam says, kriteyadhyayato vishnum.
Kriteyadhyayato vishnum.
Kriteyadhyayato vishnum.
that is the recommendation and in the second age Treta Yuga the duration of life reduces and there
is some irreligiosity because with time there is a degradation in the consciousness of the
people of the human beings so vice is introduced irreligion is introduced in Treta Yuga and
gradually the religious principles reduce by one-fourth in Treta Yuga so the method is
performance of five-fold.
Fire sacrifice Treta Ayaam Yajato Makhaihi people are recommended to perform fire sacrifices
as again given in the authorized Vedic scriptures and there are varieties of sacrifices for
varieties of people different purposes.
But ultimately all
such sacrifices are aimed at satisfying the Supreme Personality of Godhead only.
And in Dwapar Yuga it is temple worship Dwapare Parijari Ayaam temple worship of the Lord
in different Deity forms installed Deity forms so that is the method in Dwapar Yuga and Kali Yuga
Kalavata Hari Kirtanath the method is a performance of Sankirtan Yajna so Aarshala Prabhupada says
in other words sacrifice means to accept the supremacy of the Lord and thereby perform
acts by which the Lord may be satisfied in all respects religion means to please the
Supreme Lord by the recommended method as given in the scriptures because scriptures
are given by the Supreme Lord.
So Yajna ultimately means to please the Supreme Lord after accepting his supremacy he is the
Supreme Personality, he is the Supreme Controller, he is Supreme Maintainer, he is Supreme well
wisher, he is Supreme Lord.
Every perspective you see he is the Supreme.
